captions.text:
This microwave listens to popcorn popping
to perfectly cook popcorn every time.

And the Iowa Storm Chasing Network recently
unveiled a 10,000 pound armored van specifically
designed to get closer than ever to tornados.
Vsauce! Kevin here. This is Mind Blow.

The Sulon Cortex Headset hopes to merge the
real world with virtual reality. The idea

is to overlay a virtual environment on your
physical surroundings. It works using a head

position tracker and a game controller tracker
along with a sensor package that maps the

world around you. Basically turning the real
world into a video game. Developer kits are
available for pre-order right now.

Neuroscape Lab created a real-time 3D visualization
of the human brain. The colors represent source

power and connectivity and the estimated information
transfer can be seen as pulses of light moving

along the fiber tracts connecting the regions
of the brain. And you can even fly through

the brain activity of someone wearing an EEG
cap using a gamepad.

Space Generator is a room concept that allows
you to create any type of room you can imagine.

Winner of the 2013 Red Dot concept award - the
pre-programmed module cells can be raised

or lowered to transform the once flat platform
into any number of 3D arrangements - creating

the space for a fashion show, a theater or
any kind of or a game installation like a
maze.

Facebook's facial recognition technology is
nearly as accurate at recognizing faces as

you are. Their research project titled DeepFace
can look at two photos and regardless of the

angle or lighting tell with 97.25% accuracy
whether they contain the same face - something

humans can do at 97.53%. This new technology
is not currently used on the Facebook website

but ostensibly could eventually be used to
link every photo of you online to your Facebook
account.

Audi's traffic light recognition system counts
down the time remaining until a red light

turns green. It works by reading the automated
signals from the city's central traffic computer

and sending that data to the driver - it will
also let you know if you can make it through

a green light or if you should start braking.
But there's no current date for when this
will be available in the U.S.

A new study shows that forgetting is actually
an active process - specifically that a protein

called Musashi is necessary for memory-loss
- hopefully this research can someday lead
to treatments for Alzheimer's disease.

This 360 degree Milky Way panorama from NASA
features two and a half million snapshots

taken over a decade and stitched together
for the first time. Find the link below to
explore this monumental space image.

Tidy Dog hopes to train your dog to put away
its toys. It uses sensors to detect the weight

of a toy when the dog puts it back in the
bin - and then dispenses a treat. Rewarding
your pooch for cleaning up.

Finally, Firefight Films created Bigger Than
Life - Ice Caves - which is the first documented
drone flight through ice caves.

I'm gonna leave you with a robot that learns
by imitating a human and then performs that

task better than the human - and as always
thanks for watching.

title: This Makes Real World A Video Game? -- Mind Blow #80
